item.title: In the past 24 hours, there has been a total of $532 million in liquidations across the entire network, with Ethereum being the most liquidated asset.
item.description: On August 20th, according to Coinglass data, the total value of liquidations across the entire network in the past 24 hours was $532 million. Ethereum accounted for $199 million of these liquidations, making it the most liquidated currency.Long positions with a value of $460 million were liquidated. A total of 148,745 people were liquidated globally. The largest single liquidation took place on Binance - BTCUSDT, with a value of $9.695 million.

item.title: LookOnChain: Ethereum Falls Below $4100
item.description: On August 20th, according to HTX market data, Ethereum fell below $4,100 and is currently trading at $4,089.7, indicating a 24-hour decrease of 2.36%.

item.title: Franklin Templeton CEO: Crypto Investment Should Focus on Infrastructure Rather Than Bitcoin
item.description: On August 20th, Jenny Johnson, the CEO of Franklin Templeton with $1.6 trillion in assets under management, stated at the SALT Conference held in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, that Bitcoin is a "Fear Currency." In her opinion, Bitcoin has diverted people's attention away from the genuine potential of blockchain.She holds the view that the most promising investment direction within the crypto space is blockchain infrastructure, encompassing blockchain networks, consumer applications, and node validators. Johnson anticipates that in the future, mutual funds and ETFs will gradually operate on the blockchain. However, regulatory risk still poses the greatest obstacle to this transformation. She emphasized that for active investment managers, the transparency brought by validators could bring about a "game-changing" impact. (CoinDesk)

item.title: The US banking regulatory agency will proceed to address state-specific stablecoin regulatory frameworks
item.description: August 20: The U.S. Stablecoin Certification Review Board will make a determination regarding whether each state's framework is "substantially similar" to the federal stablecoin issuance system. Under the leadership of the Secretary of the Treasury, the board's members comprise the Federal Reserve Chair and the Chair of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC). These members must reach a consensus in order to enable state jurisdictions to obtain federal approval for stablecoin regulation. The "GENIUS Act" is intended to simplify state-level regulation. Gavin Meyers, the Financial Services Regulation Partner at Pierson Ferdinand LLP, stated that this act is anticipated to reduce the regulatory fragmentation among states. (Bloomberg)

item.title: The crypto market continues to experience a bearish trend this morning, with Ethereum struggling to hold above $4,100 and Bitcoin dropping below $113,000.
item.description: On August 20th, based on HTX market data, from last night to this morning, the crypto market continued to show a bearish trend. Specifically, Ethereum dropped to approximately $4100 and is currently priced at $4107.89, with a 24-hour decline of 2.02%. Bitcoin fell below $113,000 and is currently priced at $112,895.92, with a 24-hour decline of 0.78%. On the news front, the main bearish factors may stem from the decline in the US stock market and international macroeconomic uncertainties: the US stock market closed on Tuesday, with the Dow showing a slight increase, the S&P 500 down by 0.58%, and the Nasdaq down by 1.46%. The Russia-Ukraine conflict escalated once again, and the market anticipates that Powell's speech may potentially shatter the expectations of a 50 basis point rate cut.

item.title: In the last 1 hour, the total liquidation across the network was $61.9545 million, with only short positions liquidated totaling $0.7009 million.
item.description: On August 20th, according to Coinglass data, within the past 1 hour, the total liquidation across the network was $61.9545 million. The total long liquidations were $61.2536 million, and the short liquidations were $0.7009 million.The liquidations of Bitcoin amounted to $13.9272 million, while the liquidations of Ethereum reached $18.9156 million.

item.title: Ethereum Reserve Asset Stocks Experience Broad Decline, SBET and BMNR Both Drop Over 9%
item.description: On August 20th, based on market data, the Ethereum Reserve concept stocks in the US stock market witnessed a general decline. These included:- SharpLink Gaming (SBET.US), which dropped by 9.42%;- Bitmine Immersion Technologies (BMNR.US), with a decrease of 9.97%;- BTCS (BTCS.US), down by 13.45%;- GameSquare (GAME.US), falling by 10.53%;- Bit Digital (BTBT.US), declining by 8.16%.

item.title: Federal Reserve Governor: Fed's Views on AI and Cryptocurrency 'About to Change'
item.description: On August 20th, Federal Reserve Board Governor Bowman expressed that banks and regulatory agencies must embrace the advantages of new technologies like artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency. Otherwise, their role in the economy could be weakened.In her speech, she stated, "Change is approaching." She proposed that ideally, regulatory agencies would enable new use cases to "soar in a manner that benefits the banking system." She further added, "If we do not adopt this approach, we may run the risk of the banking system's relevance to consumers, businesses, and the overall economy decreasing."Bowman called on the industry to assist regulatory agencies in better understanding blockchain and digital assets, as well as the potential of new technologies to address issues such as fraud. She also indicated that she would strive to reduce regulatory oversight related to reputational risk, suggesting the possibility of new rulemaking. (FXStreet)

item.title: The U.S. Includes 407 Steel and Aluminum Derivative Products in Tariff List
item.description: August 20th: On August 19th in the local time zone, the U.S. Department of Commerce announced that 407 product categories have been included in the steel and aluminum tariff list, and the tariff rate is 50%.The Department of Commerce declared that the new list encompasses a wide variety of products, such as wind turbines and their components, mobile cranes, railway vehicles, furniture, compressors, pumps, and hundreds of other products. (CCTV)

item.title: White House: The Presidents of Russia and Ukraine have expressed their willingness to sit down for negotiations
item.description: August 20th: On August 19th in the local time, the White House Press Secretary Levi declared that the U.S. military will not be deployed within Ukraine but can offer assistance through coordination and security. Trump has given instructions to the National Security Council to collaborate with Europe.Levi stated that Trump has put forward a solution for NATO to purchase American weapons. Levi also mentioned that Russian President Putin and Ukrainian President Zelensky have shown a willingness to have negotiations. Trump hopes for direct diplomatic talks between Russia and Ukraine. Currently, arrangements are being made for Zelensky to meet with Putin. (FXStreet)
